subject: Re: ActiveTestSuite confusion - no more!
msgSnippet: Guess what, I finally figured out the problem on my own.  ActiveTestSuite does not *have* the behavior I was describing--it s all in the way I was *using* it!
messageBody:
Guess what,

I finally figured out the problem on my own. ActiveTestSuite does
not *have* the behavior I was describing--it's all in the way I was
*using* it!

Here's what I was doing (slightly simplified):

TestSuite ts = new TestSuite(Foo.class);
TestSuite ats = new ActiveTestSuite();
for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++)
ats.addTest(ts);

This had the undesired effect of having multiple threads share the
same TestCase instances. But all I had to do was change to this:

TestSuite ats = new ActiveTestSuite();
for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++)
ats.addTest(new TestSuite(Foo.class));

(again, simplified)--and it behaves just like I wanted.

Of *course*. Now that I've found the answer, it seems so obvious!

Attention authors: Can these alternate usage examples be added to the
ActiveTestSuite javadocs?

Kevin


--- In junit@y..., Kevin Bourrillion <kevinb@m...> wrote:
> I don't think I understand ActiveTestSuite.
>
> The best I can tell, I should be able to run the same suite
> simultaneously in multiple threads by doing this:
>
> static Test createThreadedTest(Test test, int numThreads) {
> TestSuite ats = new ActiveTestSuite();
> for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++)
> ats.addTest(test);
> return ats;
> }
>
> And this does basically that. But the problem is, all the threads
> are acting on the same actual TestCase instances. Meaning that my
> test case "firmament" becomes pretty much useless--an object I
> initialize in setUp() might have been mucked with by another thread
> by the time I use it!
>
> ...
>
> So, anyone know how ActiveTestSuite was intended to be used?
> Documentation is very slight.
>
> Thanks!
> Kevin
